keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support Theresa May in getting the best possible deal from the Brexit negotiations including an end to the way the EU actively discriminates against Commonwealth families and migrants.
Empower local communities in Newham to take action on litter, dog mess, fly-tipping, and anti-social behaviour.
Champion the self-employed and owners of small businesses which make our community so vibrant and entrepreneurial.

mentions.candidate: Every vote for Patrick is a vote for Theresa May Strong, Stable Leadership in the National Interest

issues.brexitEurope: Support Theresa May in getting the best possible deal from the Brexit negotiations.
issues.immigration: Support Theresa May in getting the best possible deal from the Brexit negotiations including an end to the way the EU actively discriminates against Commonwealth families and migrants.

housing.content: The need to address the demand for high-quality housing across the borough which doesn't have an adverse impact on our schools, roads and health services.

leaflet.personalStatement: Patrick works for the country’s leading social justice campaign group and specialises in education, skills, poverty, and employment. He has successfully campaigned on a variety of issues of great concern to West Ham residents, such as the quality of our street environment, the need to tackle anti-social behaviour and the need to address the demand for high-quality housing across the borough which doesn't have an adverse impact on our schools, roads and health services. For Patrick, being a Conservative is about bringing communities together and supporting the least advantaged in society but also generating the sort of wealth for people who want to get on in life. His interests outside work and politics include socialising with friends, running, playing tennis and going to watch England play rugby at Twickenham.
